noun.description: A small pool of liquid, especially of rainwater on the ground.
Clay and sand mixed with water and used as a watertight covering for embankments.

verb.description: Wet or cover (a surface) with water, especially rainwater.
examples: the cobbles under our feet were wet and puddled

origin: Middle English: diminutive of Old English pudd ditch, furrow; compare with German dialect Pfudel pool.
